parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking and reporting campaign spending, mandated for candidates.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to "un ales" (an elected official), and implicitly promotes the actions of Brian Cristian, who is identified as the subject of the Facebook page and the advertiser. While not explicitly naming him in every sentence, the context strongly implies that the achievements described are his.  The post highlights his work in Parliament, suggesting an electoral objective. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform.  It is not a private message; therefore, it addresses the wide population. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's core message is to highlight Brian Cristian's parliamentary work, implicitly encouraging voters to choose "people who work for you." This clearly aims to influence voters' choices in the upcoming election. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. While it mentions facts (number of questions and interpellations), it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. The language used ("Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi" - Choose people who work for you) is overtly persuasive and promotional, not informative.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message designed to promote a candidate's image and influence voting behavior. The positive portrayal of Brian Cristian's actions is not a neutral observation but a strategic communication aimed at garnering votes.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>889472632963010</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a candidate (Brian Cristian), is targeted at a wide audience via a paid Facebook advertisement, has a clear electoral objective (influencing votes), and does not adhere to journalistic standards of objectivity. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's timing is crucial; even if the official campaign period has ended, posting this after the legal deadline is a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR Maramures</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul postării 889472632963010, care promovează direct candidatul Brian Cristian, evidențiind activitatea sa parlamentară pentru a influența votul alegătorilor.  Postarea, care conține numărul CMF 11240015,  folosește un limbaj persuasiv ("Alegeți oameni care muncesc pentru voi"),  depășind limitele jurnalismului obiectiv și având ca efect electoral creșterea popularității lui Brian Cristian.  Această acțiune constituie propagandă electorală ilegală după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
